word.entryDescription: a large animal with four legs and long hair over its neck. People ride horses, or use them pulling things
word.entryExample: The horse's name is Sandy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: plural of 'hour' - a period of 60 minutes
word.entryExample: This film is three hours long.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a single building in which people live
word.entryExample: She lives in a littte house with a red door.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when you are hungry you need to eat food
word.entryExample: I'm hungry. Can I have a sandwich?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to feel or cause pain
word.entryExample: I can't go to school, my leg hurts so much.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very cold sweet food made from frozen milk, sugar and flavour
word.entryExample: At the beach we all have an ice cream.
word.label: ydp

word.entryExample: What's in this box?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in a position that is before someone or something else
word.entryExample: The teacher stands in frond of the whiteboard.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in a room, house or building, not outside
word.entryExample: Playing inside is boring.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: good at understanding, learning and thinking with reason
word.entryExample: I think she's the most intelligent girl in my class.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: holds your attention because you want to learn more
word.entryExample: Is your book interesting, Lucy?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a spoken or written request for somebody to come and do something
word.entryExample: I'm making invitations for Kim's party.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to ask someone to come to your home or an event
word.entryExample: Do you think I should invite Kate to the party tonight?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: you say this when you see rain (=water from clouds in the sky)
word.entryExample: Oh dear, it's raining - what can we do?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a short coat
word.entryExample: Dad is wearing his green jacket.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: trousers made from denim
word.entryExample: Do you want to wear these jeans today?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you do to earn money
word.entryExample: I got my first summer job as a shop assistant.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables
word.entryExample: I bought a big carton of apple juice
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to use your legs to push up off or away from a surface
word.entryExample: I always laugh and jump when I'm happy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a warm piece of clothing you wear on the top half of your body, often made of wool
word.entryExample: I wear a green jumper to school.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an activity in which you jump
word.entryExample: Stop jumping on your bed!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area where there are a lot of trees in a hot country
word.entryExample: Parrots live in the jungle.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an Australian animal which moves by jumping on its strong back legs and carries its young in a pocket on its stomach
word.entryExample: Kangaroos come from in Australia.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to hit a ball with your foot
word.entryExample: I'm not very good at kicking a ball.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a word that is short for kilogram
word.entryExample: We need two kilos of potatoes.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a unit for measuring the weight of 1000 grams
word.entryExample: How many kilograms does this washing machine weigh?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: someone who is kind likes to give and be helpful to other people
word.entryExample: It was very kind of her to drive us all the way home.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a man who rules a country because he is royal
word.entryExample: The lion is often called the king of animals.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a room where you cook food
word.entryExample: Mum is making dinner in the kitchen.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a toy made of paper or cloth which you fly in the air while you hold it on a long string
word.entryExample: Let's fly a kite on the beach.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a young cat
word.entryExample: My cat has five kittens.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of your body where your upper and lower leg join
word.entryExample: My knee sometimes hurts after a very long walk.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to have information in your mind or to have experience of something
word.entryExample: Do you know Ann?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an Australian animal like a small grey bear that lives in trees
word.entryExample: Can I take pictures of the koala in the tree?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large area of water away from the sea which has land all around it
word.entryExample: Finland is famous for its lakes.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a young sheep
word.entryExample: The lamb is very small.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thing you use in a room to make it light
word.entryExample: This lamp reminds me of some fairy tale - it is so beautiful!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: arriving or happening after the time agreed or expected
word.entryExample: Hurry up, I don't want to be late for school.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: at a future time
word.entryExample: See you later!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to make sounds with your voice, because you think something is funny or you are happy
word.entryExample: We laughed at the funny film.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a flat green thing that grows on a plant or a tree
word.entryExample: The leaves fall off the trees in autumn.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to understand and remember a piece of information
word.entryExample: I learn English.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the two long parts of the lower half of your body
word.entryExample: You walk with your legs.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very sour fruit with a thick yellow skin and yellow flesh
word.entryExample: Lemons are good for your health.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sweet fizzy drink with the taste of lemon
word.entryExample: Would you like a glass of cold lemonade?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a period of time in which you are taught something
word.entryExample: The English lesson was good.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a message which you write on ap iece of paper,put in an envelope and send
word.entryExample: I don't write letters any more, I only write emails.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small hole in a door or wall for the postman to put letter into
word.entryExample: He pushed the magazine through the letterbox.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a vegetable with large green leaves often eaten raw in salads
word.entryExample: We need a lot of lettuce for the salad.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a room containing a lot of books, magazines, etc, which people can borrow or read there
word.entryExample: There are a lot of English books in the library.
word.label: ydp
